data.title: FiXT Neon – FiXT Music
data.text:
Celebrates 15 Year Anniversary

“Some of you already know I’ve signed several bad records deals in my career. That prompted me early on to create my own independent label, FiXT. We wondered through the years if we could survive as a label, and here we are 15 years later, with the biggest and best roster, staff and resources we’ve ever had, and there’s a lot more to come.”

– Klayton (President & Founder, FiXT)

Los Angeles, California – FiXT, the independent, artist-owned record label from artist/producer Klayton (best known for his projects Celldweller, Scandroid, and Circle of Dust), has announced a full company rebrand today. In addition to visual branding changes, FiXT announced major updates to its 2 existing label divisions, FiXT and FiXT Neon, along with launching a 3rd, all-new EDM division, FiXT Noir.

FiXT’s rock/metal division, which has been operating since 2006, has been re-branded as FiXT Radium. The label has announced 4 new exclusive artist signings – the division’s first female fronted electronic-rock project, Daedric, UK electro-nu-core 6-piece Seething Akira, Eastern Europe electro-metal duo Nitroverts, and Canada-based artist Richy Nix with his metal meets hip-hop fusion. The new signings join FiXT Radium’s existing roster featuring The Algorithm, The Anix, Becko, Celldweller, Circle of Dust, Fight The Fade, I Will Never Be The Same, NUTRONIC, Raizer, Soul Extract, Voicians, and Void Chapter.

FiXT Neon, the company’s synthwave, indie pop, and chillwave division, which launched in 2018, has announced the exclusive signing of retro synth pop duo Nouveau Arcade, based out of Washington. The project joins FiXT Neon’s existing artist roster, including Ace Marino, The Bad Dreamers, Cassetter, DEADLIFE, Essenger, FreqGen, Fury Weekend, LeBrock, Mega Drive, Moonrunner83, OVRGRWN, Polyark, PRIZM, Scandroid, Signal Void, and Young Medicine.

“I absorbed a lot of electronic music through the ’80s and ’90s and that would eventually lead to the sound of Celldweller. For those who have been following, you know that I’ve collaborated with some big names in EDM, and FiXT operated the world’s largest EDM merch store for many years. So here it is, 2021, and I’m really excited to announce the launch of FiXT’s brand new EDM label division, FiXT Noir.”

– Klayton (President & Founder, FiXT)

FiXT Noir, the company’s all new EDM label division announced the debut exclusive roster signing of UK metal/drum & bass producer Toronto Is Broken, along with upcoming releases from a wide ranging list of artists, including: Celldweller, Biometrix, Teddy Killerz, KJ Sawka, Becko, Aktive, Tenebrax, Glacier, Elliot Berger, Social Kid, BVLVNCE, Zardonic, Blosso, Everen Maxwell, Similar Outskirts, Tadeusz, Everything Must Go, A_Rival, Too Kind, Ian Snow, Totto, Deuce & Charger, Punker, Gazz, Foxhunt, Matt Neux, Natty Campbell, Killin Void, Asteroid Afterparty, KYB, Timian, Neddie, Mattsh, NVFNAL, Shaded Grains, Only Kidding, and more.

FiXT Noir launches with its debut release “Traction” by Neddie, out everywhere July 14th, with Toronto Is Broken’s full-length album Clare featuring an all new remix from Zardonic dropping July 16th. The label’s release schedule will consist of dual releases each week moving forward.

Watch The Full Announcement Event:

Celebrating the company’s 15 year anniversary milestone, FiXT revealed it reaches millions of listeners each month and has accrued billions of streams and thousands of Film/TV/Video Game placements across its catalog. The company highlighted industry membership associations with A2iM (American Association of Independent Music), Merlin, and FUGA, providing its artists with industry leading distribution, premium DSP deals, and relationships.

For more information, visit www.fixtmusic.com.

Follow FiXT Radium:

https://fanlink.to/followfixt

Follow FiXT Neon:

https://fanlink.to/followfixtneon

Follow FiXT Noir:

https://fanlink.to/followfixtnoir

2020 goes out with a bang for the FiXT Neon Team. With a slew of interviews, contests, and signing several new artists, here’s a recap of some of the highlights from the year!

FiXT Neon signed two new artists in 2020, with Young Medicine joining in early 2020 leading to a re-release of Interlinked and setting the stage for more to come. The second, San Francisco-based duo OVRGRWN, with their polished indie pop music with an ’80s cinematic side were signed to a deal in late 2020. Their 2019 debut EP O Well was re-packaged and re-released in December with new material scheduled for early 2021.

Klaytreon

In November, Klayton launched a Patreon account complete with an exclusive discord.

FIXT NEON LAUNCHED A NEW MUSIC STREAM TEAM

ON TWITCH!

FiXT has embraced the stream community since 2015, where all Twitch streamers can use our original music for FREE (no DMCAs), and this year we launched our own stream team!

“FiXT was one of the first 5 labels to sign a deal with Twitch back in 2015 and make our catalog of original music Twitch safe. Since then we’ve continued to expand our interest in partnering with the streaming community, with various sponsorships as well as making our catalog available on stream-safe streaming platform Pretzel. Now, with the FiXT Music Stream Team, we’re incredibly proud to be working with a core group of passionate streamers, helping us spread the music and our message even further.”

– James Rhodes (FIXT VP & Co-Founder)

FiXT Neon Q&A Zoom Events

Launched Three Anthologies

Artist Achievements

FiXT VP, James Rhodes Has Been Busy!

In February, James Rhodes, FiXT VP hung out with No Ordinary Nerd Podcast to discuss the future of the label, expanding and adding to our label roster, music in video games, Altered Carbon and Lost in Space. In March James appeared on the Rick Barker Podcast to talk about how to use the lucrative world of gaming as a revenue stream for Indie Artists. In June he appeared on the “Built-In Iowa Podcast” to discuss building FiXT and FiXT Neon up from Burlington, Iowa. He was also recognized by A2IM for his work in supporting the growth of the independent community.

OFFICE SHENANIGANS:

The Legend Of Sneaky James

While James was away on a business trip to L.A. the FiXT Team missed him so much they gave the entire office a makeover in his image! Legend has it you can still see James’s face in every deep dark corner of the office if you look hard enough.

FiXT & FiXT Neon Stats

From everyone in the FiXT Neon Team – thanks for a great 2020 and we can’t wait to see what’s in store for 2021 and beyond!
